characters: TELL ME LOUDER WHO THE MAN
I WANNA COME IN YOUR HOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned looking trailer sits on top of two 15-foot-t oil drums. Distant thunder trembles through the peeling metal panels. The structure is in such disrepair, that surely no one lives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then, a light goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny hand sculpts the mud on top of a crawfish hole pla on the floor. We pan up to reveal a little girl examining baby chicken that appears to be dead. This is HUSHPUPPY, unkempt and seemingly uncared for six-year-old with a gaz unmistakable wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy places the chick on the crawfish hole, like a q on her throne and the chick twitches to life, cheeps twic Hushpuppy's esoteric science experiment is interrupted by DISTANT THUNDER. Her eyes stand to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eerie, harsh wind whips hay and dust through over a gi slumbering pot-belly pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, donned in boys' underpants and a child-sized w beater, tip-toes behind the epic creature. She studies it wonderful, is this the source of the thunder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the utmost delicacy, she lays a hand on the pig's be We hear his HUGE BEATING HEART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of glimpses of Hushpuppy's scientific method. Sh chases geese, chickens, ducks, dogs around the property- cross between an abandoned farm and salvage yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy grabs a baby chick and puts it to her ear. A TI HEARTBEAT. She listens with focused wonder and intensity. 2

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All the time, everywhere, everything's organs be beatin' and squirtin' and talkin' to each other in ways I can't understand. Mosta the time they probably just sayin' "I'm hungry," or "I gotta poop," but sometimes they talkin' in codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's eyes dart up as a MAN'S VOICE yells-

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Get up, get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a YOWL as a cat is flung across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window made from a gas station sign opens in a Robinson Crusoe style tree house patched together from storm debri and discarded appliances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wild man with severe features, a frazz of unkempt hair, brawler's scars opens a window made from a metal sign. Th is WINDELL EMMETT DOUCET, known to all as WINK (39).  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your pants on, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink kills a beer and sends it out the hole in the wall i a basketball hoop attached to a fishing net that stretche feet down to the ground. The net is overflowing with beer cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy obediently climbs a series of increasingly bigg and bigger oil drums that function like a ladder, up to t door of her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see Wink in his morning ritual. He opens a cooler with a butchered chicken inside it and tosses the bird on grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the front porch and pours down a bag of dog fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a clothesline that leads to Hushpuppy's trailer. BELL RINGS. 3   WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed up time! Feed up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, now wearing pants and a slightly more proper T shirt, comes running down the oil barrels to her house. S echoes her Daddy.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed up time! Feed up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy devours the whole roast chicken with her hands, getting right in there like it was a candy apple. It look really yummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pigs, dogs, chickens, and cats are chowing down all aroun her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatch opens above her and we realize we're in the botto the Shacko. Wink sticks his head through the hatch and th corn to the chickens.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Share with the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy rips off a piece of chicken and flings it to a filthy chihuahua with no hair on the back half of its bod This is WINDELL, in spite of her circumstances, quite a handsome young pup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE, we see Hushpuppy and Wink drift through the marsh. They ride in a severed truck bed floating on top of oil drums. A motor is strapped to the back. A sign on the boa reads "The Turck", Hushpuppy's spelling of "Truck".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look out to where the water goes all the way to a monolithic, 20 foot wall stretching infinitely into the distance. This levee, the first piece of modern construct we've seen, encloses the civilized world, protecting it f rising water. The Bathtub is on the wrong side of wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink stares out at the distant factories behind the wall a peaceful and confident disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushuppy matches his relaxed defiant expression. 4   WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that ugly over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a long pull on his beer.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We live in the prettiest place on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks over the wall to the Dry Side. It's an endless sprawl of oil processing power plants without a t or bird in sight. This is the engine that runs the Northe world.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daddy says, up above the levee, on the dry side, they're afraid of the water like a bunch of babies. They built the wall that cuts us off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fly over marsh and water, coming upon a tiny crop of shanties on an island perched at the very bottom of the l

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They think we all gonna drown down here. But we ain't goin' nowhere.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Hushpuppy letting out a WARRIOR SCREAM in a mass HOLLERING people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand on a long and crumbling road surrounded on bot sides by water. The rag tag band of revelers charge forwa WHOOPING and SHOUTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy kisses her hand and smacks the town sign. "Isle Charles Doucet" is crossed out and someone has graffitied "The Bathtub." Each party-goer repeats Hushpuppy's kiss a smack in wild, ritualistic fashion.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Bathtub's got more holidays than the whole rest of the world. 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The townspeople charge in a rousing parade. Everyone drag trails of beer cans, boat parts, anything they can tie to themselves that makes a lot of noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are the hard faces of fishermen and their feisty wiv downtrodden but with a sense of fortitude among them, a community of heart, spirit, passion, and reckless abandon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see none of the separations that we're used to in mode society. There is no evidence of politics, religion, clas race or any other divisive ideology. The Bathtub is a pla of true and honest unity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megaphones sticking out a gutted mini-van broadcast the C band playing inside. Fiddle, saw, guitar, and double-bass players struggle to hold onto their instruments and the t bounces them down a dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive under a banner reading "Welcome to the Bathtub Storm Season!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink and Hushpuppy rattle along on a float made from the front end of a pickup truck. Over the front cabin rears a giants sculpture of a horse-head made out of wooden spike metal plates, and heavy chains. Carnival-dressed maniacs clamber on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink hollers and waves to people. He fires jets of beer i the mouths of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy dances on the back of the float. Though she's t tiniest member of this very adult parade, she's right in thick of everything. No one is checking I.Ds Here.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daddy always saying, that up in the dry world, they got none of what we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town dances around the band in a clearing in the wood Everyone is bouncing to the music, smiling and joking wit one another.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They only got holidays once a year. 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six babies, each with a racing number pinned to their dia are placed by their enthusiastic mammas at a starting-lin a track marked by two adjacent crowds of onlookers. Bets flying between the spectators as if they're about to watc cock-fight.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All babies to the race! Come up to the starting line! The baby race is about to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy dances in the cheering crowd, swigging a bottle something she probably shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STARTING GUN fires, and the babies make a crawl for it. Most of them are paralysed in tears or bewilderment, but brave soul toddles towards victory.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They got fish stuck in plastic wrappers, they got their babies stuck in carriages, and chickens on sticks and all that kind of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks up at Wink who is dancing with his best friend WALRUS (60), a slack jawed, white haired, pinked nosed, handsome devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby crosses the finish line, ahead of the rest, victorious. The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink opens his trawl net and dumps a massive catch into a picking pan. There's food to feed a hundred in the haul. one is a bit fazed though, this is just your average nigh fishing in the Bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrimp, crabs, and small leaping fish struggle over one another for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy helps him sort the catch. Winks's hands move wi virtuosic ease, separating the crabs from the shrimp. She studies Wink's every move and tries to measure up to her Dad's proficiency. He doesn't demonstrate or explain anything, but we sense there is a system of education in place here. 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy focuses in on a tiny fish, wriggling and suckin it's last breaths of air.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One day, the storm's gonna blow, the ground's gonna sink, and the water's gonna rise up so high, there ain't gonna be no Bathtub, just a whole bunch of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pick up a crab, pets its belly. The DIN of the party fades down around her as she listens to its HEARTBEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosions everywhere as Bathtubers rampage blasting fireworks down the street instead of into the air. Men dressed as women, women dressed as men, in some kind of reckless esoteric ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCORE kicks in hard with a tinge of ominous forboding We sense that in spite of the ecstatic energy, the unbrid joy, that a cloud hangs over this community. The people a parting like it's there last day on earth, and we feel viscerally, that it could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs in the thick of it behind Wink waving a fountain sparkler. Wink trips and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink lies on his back on the ground. He sees his daughter watching him, holding the huge sparkler, and they both la with sheer joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stops over him and points a bottle rocket in hi face, the fuse burning. He nods his approval. They watch the fuse burn down to the last moment. She turns it upwar and they watch her rocket join a sky filled with pluming mortars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks at the light flickering across Wink's fac He's momentarily peaceful, admiring the spectacular displ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy smiles at him with pride. He doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run off into the crowd, which is pulsating at the pinnacle of mayhem. The OMINOUS MUSIC shifts gears into a BLASTING PATRIOTIC HYMN of the Bathtub. Throw your fist i the air! These are the survivors, those who fight for the joy and their history to the last man. 8

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But me and my Daddy, we stay right here. We who the earth is for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs right at us with detonating fireworks in b hands, engulfed by light. She swings them toward camera a the screen is engulfed in an inferno of sparks. A white o Black letters slam down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUTS abruptly as a basket of crawfish is slammed in front of camera. The crawfish squirming and struggling fo life engulfs the screen.  WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fearsome, uncompromising leader, sexy like a lady bullfighter, peeks at Hushpuppy over a mass of squirming crawfish. This is MISS BATHSHEBA (36).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to three students, pushing their heads with he finger, each time announcing:  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twelve students follow her through a maze of creature caged in mason jars, basins, and boxes with breathing hol her educational tools.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every animal is made out of meat. I am meat, ya'll asses meat. Everything is part of the buffet of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba rolls up the leg of her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This here, is an Aurochs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding her thigh, is tattooed a scene much like a cave painting in Lascaux. In thick black ink, it depicts a bat between early men wielding spears, and giant bull-like animals bearing down over them. 9

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A fierce, mean creature that roamed the earth back when we all lived in caves. They would gobble the cave- babies down right in front of their cave-parents. And the cavemen couldn't do nothing about it, because they were too poor, too stupid, too small. Who here thinks the Cavemen were sitting around crying like a buncha pussies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children stare blankly, no one raises their hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches a heroic crawfish crest the basket, fal the floor, and make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba snatches up the rogue crawdad and flings i back into the vat.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Y'all better think about that. Cause any day now, the fabric of the universe is coming unraveled. The ice caps gonna melt, the water's gonna rise, and everything south of the levee's going under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to a map showing a ragged coastline. On the wr side of a giant line marked "levee" is an island labeled Bathtub."

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ain't gonna be no Bathtub, just a whole bunch of water. Y'all better learn to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mysterious COLD WIND fills the air. Hushpuppy stares in a wall poster of an ice cliff reading: THE SOUTH POLE.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Way back in the day, the Aurochs was king of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH CUT to the PANORAMA of an ice cliff, but now it's r 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT CLOSER to overwhelming white light accompanied by intermittent FROZEN CRACKS that build in frequency and volume.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for giant snowballs, and the iced age. I wouldn't even be Hushpuppy, I would just be breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light dims in intensity to reveal, frozen deep inside ice wall, barely visible- a fanged, hairy, bloated, stone aged creature, the same as on Miss Bathsheba's leg. This an Aurochs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy climbs a metal ladder made from a railing, up t Wink's shanty in the trees. Windell, her dirty Chihuahua, follows behind.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? Feed-up time. Feed-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy bangs on the door of the shacko.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks the Shacko for food. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hours later, Hushpuppy stands on a metal bin look into the distance.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like some sort of animal call, she SHRIEKS. 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy draws a picture of Wink on a foldout mattress..

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kids that got no Mamma, no Daddy and nobody. They got to live in the woods, and eat grass, and steal underpants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy lays down next to her drawing of Wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windell, the Chihuahua and the potbelly pig awake to gree the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy peers into the ground floor of the shacko.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If Daddy don't get home soon, it's gonna be time for me to start eating my pets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids walk home with their parents after a day at the Schoolboat, which we now see is big a yellow houseboat floating on the bayou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy waits alone, no one has come to get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba locks up the door and heads for her small motor boat tied off on the side of the school.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a ride, boo?  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Daddy's coming to pick me up.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about food or something, you hungry? 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy shakes her head `no'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba's doesn't totally believe her, but she's n the type to coddle either.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, well suit yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba motors away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy waits until she's out of sight and starts walki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing don't-touch-the-floor, Hushpuppy navigates her ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has with holes in the walls blocked with old clo and paper towels. Homemade toys fill every surface. This the domain of a child at loose ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy leaps over her bed- a nook piled with clothes- plugs in the Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O)
dialogues.text: Everything we still got from Mamma, we keep in my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push in on a shrine to her mother:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red basketball jersey. An apron. A sawed-off shotgun. A child's drawing of a beautiful lady.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daddy says, the first time she looked at me, it made her heart beat so big, that she thought it would blow up. That's why she swam away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy takes the jersey down. She puts it over a chair the dining area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy gets a can of cat food. A pot. Water in a bowl. Her actions have a sad sense of routine to them- she's be left alone before, and has her own self-invented system f feeding herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens a can of cat food, takes it out with her hand a throws it in a pot. She licks the remnants off her finger 13   MARIETTA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi my sweet baby.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi momma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTA, Hushpuppy's imaginary, invisible mamma, is spea from the basketball jersey chair. Marietta functions like imaginary friend- Hushpuppy is the only one who can see h Hushpuppy takes the pot, puts it on the stove.  MARIETTA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy what you doing there? You being good like I taught you?  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, mamma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy turns on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy goes through her safety precautions: oven mitts helmet, she flips the table and hides behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She aims the stove lighter: a flame thrower made from a cigarette lighter and a can of spray deodorant. A spray o flames ignites the stove in a FIREBALL.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMENTS LATER. Hushpuppy behind the bubbling stove. She t on an apron and sways to the music. She is dressing like mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marietta's Voice sings to her.  MARIETTA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good, you make me happy / you're good, you make me happy.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty Mamma.  MARIETTA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty Hushpuppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares into the floating islands of cat food fr in fat, which in her POV is a surreal churning vision, li the bubbling lava at the center of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's SHOCKED out of her vision by a YOWLING CAT being fl across the yard. 14

dialogues.speaker: WINK, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Get out of my way you fat animal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy jumps down from the stove, grabs a bowl of wate and runs to greet Wink,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clambers down the oil drum ladder spilling her water everywhere in her excitement.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! Daddy, Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink doesn't turn to acknowledge her as he trudges across field toward his Shacko. He's wearing a hospital patient' smock and no shoes, it seems he checked himself out.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned lots of stuff while you gone. If I drink all this here I can burp like a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy gulps down water, all of it. Wink keeps walking Hushpuppy BURPS like a man, but he doesn't turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stops to examine the situation. Something's not right here.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you wearing a dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy tugs his patient's smock and he shrugs her off violently.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees his hospital I.D bracelet still on.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wearing a bracelet too?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go in your house, you wouldn't understand.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna come in your house. 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy whacks Wink's butt.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink fakes like he's gonna smack her.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy tears off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink storms into the Shacko in the Backo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stomps inside. Her cat food is burning, with st jetting up to the ceiling. She thinks about it for a mome and turns the burner up. Smoke billows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy grabs her basketball jersey off the chair and j over the breakfront counter. Behind her A MASSIVE GREASE EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy ducks down, panicking. She check over the media The stove is on engulfed in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy scrambles under a cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls of the box are decorated with years of her drawings. In here she feels a strange safety. The FLAMES and BREAKING WINDOWS feel distant and muffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She draws a hieroglyphic of herself sad and crying on an island with a sun and a palm tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peeks out as Wink runs into the house, which is fille with black smoke, flickering flames.

dialogues.speaker: WINK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (panicking from inside) Hushpuppy!? Boss lady!? Hushpuppy where you at!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy drops the box closed. Smoke billows into the bo filling it up. 16

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O)
dialogues.text: If Daddy kill me, I ain't gonna be forgotten, I'm recording my story for the scientists of the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy draws a bigger figure giving her a hug as Wink' panicked fury intensifies outside.

dialogues.speaker: WINK, (O.S)
dialogues.text: HUSHPUPPY!? Where are you Boss!?

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O)
dialogues.text: In a million years, when kids go to school, they gonna know that once there was Hushpuppy and she lived with her Daddy in the Bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pulls Hushpuppy's drawings off the walls, he flings out the door to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink has heard. He looks toward the box.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy and makes a runs for it, flying out the door.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you run away from me. I swear to GOD Hushpuppy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs out of Wink's compound into the woods, Win her trail. In the background, the house is a towering inferno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run deeper into the swamp.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tearing off!  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't tearing off nothin', I'll bust your ass! 17   HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tearing off just like my Momma.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink tried to yank her toward home and Hushpuppy refuses. She digs her heels in.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what happens. See what happens to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy hooks her leg around a tree and holds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink slaps Hushpuppy and she falls face down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks away, disgusted with himself.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what you making me do? You're killing me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down and tries to pick her up.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up and now come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy jumps up on her own.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you do die! And after you die, I come to your grave and eat birthday cake all by myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy punches Wink in the heart and suddenly EVERYTHI GOES QUIET, as if all the insects in the forest have hush

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once, we hear--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUMAN HEART, beating until there is a SONIC BOOM, an earsplitting CRACK of glacial ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy turns toward the sound. When she turns back Win face has transformed, wrenches with fear and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink keels over clutching his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares, her breath accelerating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's eyes roll back in his head, he begins to seizure. 18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER GLACIAL CRACK rings out. The SPLITTING builds to DEAFENING ROAR. She covers her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fissures appear like lightning through the massive ice cl from the opening of the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs from the sound, hands over her ears. We INTERCUT with shots of falling glaciers. The universe is coming unravelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ice shelf COLLAPSES into the ocean in a MASSIVE AVALAN a wave rolls toward camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave, now just a tiny ripple, hits Hushpuppy's feet. Suddenly, the water level rises around her. It overtakes knees and keeps going. Hushpuppy backs up to shore, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy calls out to a distant beacon flashing on the horizon.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma!? Momma!? MOMMA!? I think I broke something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs out of the woods toward school in a total panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the school parents pile their children into a pickup trucks and vans.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba! Miss Bathsheba! My Daddy fell down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba takes Hushpuppy's hands as she tries to ca her breath to speak. Clutched in her hand is the hospital bracelet that Wink had been wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathsheba turns over the diagnostic bracelet and reads it her eyes widen in recognition and alarm. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches Miss Bathsheba frantically pull herbs a roots from her containers of medicinal oddities and pack into a large medicine jar.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be OK baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathsheba hands Hushpuppy the medicine jar.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ok, Hushpuppy, here's what I need you to do. You take this medicine and run as fast as you can. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see glimpses of nature protecting itself from the impending disaster. Flowers curl up, insects horde food underground, RUSTLING sounds fill the air. Black birds, a bats, and all manner of flying creatures fill the sky. They're all getting the hell out of dodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, quaking with fear, runs through a menacing swa clutching her medicine jar. The rising winds swirl the ma grass all around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs to the spot where Wink collapsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks around the swamp, unable to understand.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daddy could have turned into a tree, or a bug. There wasn't any way to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy hides her medicine jar in her storage unit- a leather flap laid over the hollow of an oak tree. The hol is filled with trinkets and objects she's collected over years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy flinches as a shrieking animal calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up to see a leaf covered in writhing caterpilla One of them has been skewered by a beetle and is fighting it's life. 20

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The whole universe depends on everything fitting together just right. If one piece busts, even the smallest piece, the entire universe will get busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blocks of glaciers roll out of the avalanche and away fro Antarctica like floating ice cubes. Embedded in each cube is an Aurochs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single ice cube takes over the frame and the mammoth de Aurochs' eye stares right at us. Its jaw wide, its fangs bared, the ferocious beast appears to have fossilized mid pounce. THUNDER BOOMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift upwards into the cloud cover. As we rise above t white canopy, the spiral of a hurricane forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRINGS SWELL under HOWLING WINDS. We follow behind a lit boy running down the road with an alarm bell as the peopl the Bathtub mobilize in a frenzied evacuation.  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm's coming! The storm's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy sulks out of the woods, feeling sorry for herse She looks up and freezes like she's seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink hobbles down the road, looking shell-shocked. The traffic on the road moves in one direction: out. Wink wal back into town in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Hushpuppy's POV Wink arrives at Lady Jo's bar where a of drunken sweethearts are in their regular positions. Th are watching the evacuation go by like it's a Veteran's D parade. They giggle and hurl good-natured curses out to a family making their way to safety. 21   LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these assholes running around all over the damn place. C'est la vie assholes!  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know y'all with me. Y'all doin' the storm.  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Jo's ain't never closed honey.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. Walrus my big man, you staying?  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong number buddy. I'm outta here as soon as I finish my beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink dismisses him with a wave of his hand.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't goin nowhere.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't no sneeze comin' out the gulf. I'm gone brother.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow Walrus. Lookit there, Winston's with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINSTON is passed out on the stairs.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing about the storm Winston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without opening his eyes, Winston raises an umbrella over head. Wink laughs.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! It's Hushpuppy.  EVERYBODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy! Hushpuppy's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst into a round of drunken applause. 22   WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy? Where you been?  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to y-  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her up by the britches and carries her away.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the bus window, Hushpuppy watches Wink prepare fo the storm as branches and debris fly by him. He RANTS to himself and drinks. He ties the Turck onto the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks to where her animals lurch and freeze, ru around in circles, pant heavily. They feel it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain drops start to spatter the window and Wink trips and falls trying to catch a fleeing chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the full force of the storm HOWLS and CLATTERS the shutters. Rain screams against the corrugated metal roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink tapes padding over all sharp corners and plastic wra the furniture. He's Hushpuppy-proofing everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs a piece of duct tape across the floor.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This side is still Wink's house. No toys, and no girl stuff over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pushes charred toys from Hushpuppy's house across th line.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I want to come over that side and smack you in the face, that's against the rules. So there's a plus for you. 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is not able to see the bright side here.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now come on down here and get in the boat, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a trunk on the floor. Hushpuppy hops down an gets in. Wink sits on his air mattress.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the water get real high, we gonna float to the top and we gonna bust through the roof and we gonna ride away, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink puts a pair of mismatching water wings on her.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never NEVER take these off. I'm your Daddy, and you do what I tell you to do, because it's my job to keep you from dying, ok? So sit back and just listen to me... Close your eyes and go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches Wink pretending to sleep. The THUNDER scares the bejesus out of him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to the ceiling where water is starting to pour steadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks back at Wink who is sneaking a sip from his liquor bottle. He resumes his phony sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong gust of wind JOLTS the entire room and he spring out of bed.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you starin' at me like that? I can't sleep with you starin' at me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink paces the floor.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. You need to understand, you're a kid and I'm a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't understand. 24   WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy nods. THUNDER BOOMS and Wink is the one who flinches.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared, no storm can't beat no Doucet. I'm gonna show you. You watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he can see she's still scared.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm'll show you! We Doucets we're not scared of no damn storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink grabs a bottle of moonshine and climbs down the hatc the floor into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs to the window and peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE. The frenzy of the hurricane propels Wink at full sprint through the 100 MPH winds. He tears his clothes of and guzzles moonshine as branches fall all around him.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me! Look at me Hushpuppy! Watch me kick butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink fires his shotgun at the heavens.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yea! I'm right here! I'm right here I ain't going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THUNDER CLAP shakes the house so hard a ceiling beam CRASHES down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy runs to her bed as if it might keep her safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windell, swinging from a basket tied to the ceiling, BARK panicking herself.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma!? MAMMA!?  CUT TO: 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in the rainstorm, a glacial cube SHATTERS, flopping mammoth body onto the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's chest heaves and a LOW SNORT is heard. The animal begins to roll over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her dinosaur size hoof plants in the mud as she lifts her up. We stare over the muscular haunch of her body as she stares into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive creature turns, testing her limbs after thous of years of sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up to the storm and lets loose a GURGLING ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sit close on one of her black eyes. There is something dangerously sad in her cold gaze. Her head moves from the frame as she starts forward on her journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The storm has passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera flies high over the Bathtub. The tops of house poke out from the massive water like lily-pads in a pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slab of metal stares at us, surrounded by water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something under the metal BANGS TWICE and an axe dislodge roof panel. The axe twists and leverages off the slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink hefts Hushpuppy on top of the roof. Then Windell. Dishevelled and hung-over, he pulls himself up too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three survivors stare in stunned silence at their new world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink slowly navigates the Turck in through the flooded landscape where their town had once been. Neither he nor Hushpuppy can say a word. Everything is submerged. Every organism is dead or has fled. The quiet is overwhelming. 26

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For every animal that didn't have a Dad to put it in a boat, the end of the world already happened. They're all down below, trying to breathe through water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass abandoned house, after abandoned house, the one stilts have water up to the porches. Trees are bashed through roofs, walls are blown through, bathrooms exposed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink uses a pole to open a door.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Winston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one answers. They push off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink enters an intact house with water up to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: WINK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Edison? Ow-Wee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink leans against the door frame. From his POV we see Hushpuppy on the Turck. She picks a leaf and eats it. Win shakes his head in dismay, realizing all too clearly his is not ready for survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turck passes through a net of Spanish moss into the b of a swamp.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some day when I'm gone, you gonna be the last man in the bathtub. You have to learn how to feed your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink goes to the edge of the turck and sticks his hand in water. 27   WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, stick your left hand in this water, stick it in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy puts her right hand in the water.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, what you do is you hold your hand steady and you just wait for your fish to come. You gotta ball your fist up, this is your punching hand. Ball your fist up in case you have to whack it when they come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pulls a Catfish out with his bare hand.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOOOO YEA! Whooo lord, look what we got. I gotcha. Say "I gotcha!"  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink slams the fish down on the floor of the Turck and pi it.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea! Hold him down! Now, you hold it down like this, and whack him good with your fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pins the fish and punches it in the face.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead whack him! You whack him good. Hold him like that and whack him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy pins the fish. She tries to whack it and it cut her.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hides her cut hand from Wink.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK? That's all a part of it. 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy winces in pain.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna try it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy shakes her head no, trying not to cry.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. One more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy has enclosed herself under a table with a tablecloth on it. She's drawing on the floor with charcoa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something alive hits the roof and scurries across. We hea the entire house MOAN, or was it a distant ROAR?  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's hacking cough, which has gotten worse since last w heard it, fills the room. Hushpuppy tries to shake him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks through the gap in his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Wink's chest, surrounding his heart, a corroded spider of purple bruises shows through the skin, like varicose v covering his entire heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's eyes go wide with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beacon pulses on the distant horizon.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beacon does not respond.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've broken everything. 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud of dust circulates particles. The Haze is blindin A distant RUMBLING grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark shapes tear through the haze in a deafening stampede

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Strong animals, they know when your hearts are weak. That makes them hungry and they start coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see one at first, then more join rank around it. The Aurochs are charging in a pack. They are a biblical terro the horsemen of the apocalypse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turck moves through the cypress forest, signs are str everywhere pointing to Lady Jo's bar. It appears abandone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the door SQUEAKS open. Walrus winces at the sunlight and pops a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out the door and SPLASHES into the water.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy bowlegged Sarah!  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey partner! Hey Walrus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pulls in the Turck and paddles to rescue the thrashi drunkard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leverage Walrus aboard and lay him out on deck.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gauging his surroundings) I musta passed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink starts chuckling silently. His chuckle builds to a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the bar, empty bottles, half eaten crabs, and general party debris are littered everywhere. 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jo is sprawled on the floor under a table. Is she dead or just wasted?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She awakes with a start and bangs her head on the table.  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink and Walrus run to help her up.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (TO WALRUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't touch me you filthy bastard! (TO WINK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink, you get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both lift her.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goin' on all night `bout how tonight's the last night on earth we gotta make it count. Talkin' dirty right in front of Peter T.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Peter T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T enters from the Bathroom.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T, my man! I knew you wasn't gonna leave me man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T speaks in his polite, level-headed, soft sweet vo  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, oh no.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Peter T) That is one classic dude right there.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T, you are a titan! Glad you stayed man! RHHAAAA! 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink jiggles Peter T's ample belly. Peter T giggles with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink puts one arm around Walrus and the other around Pete He smiles to Hushpuppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs too, the first smile in quite some days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub crew are lolling in the later party stages. There is a rooster on the table looking like the most sob creature in the room by far.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had wings, I know I could have flown in that bad boy. But I would have probably bounced off a tree, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy lays on the table in pile of empty crab shells.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy! Did I ever tell you the story of your conception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar crowd chuckles.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When me and Hushpuppy's Mamma first met we was so shy, we used to sit around, and drink beer, and smile at each other. One day we was so shy we just napped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's voice FADES DOWN as Hushpuppy's fantasy takes over She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink, younger and prettier, naps in an uncharacteristical colorful lawn chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOW, GURGLING GROWL wakes him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There in the yard, crawling slow and lazy, is a massive 1 foot alligator, breathing the heavy, slutty way alligator breathe. 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A topless woman steps in front. Sweat beading on her perf shoulder blades, down her perfect, back ending in a pair boys' underpants- just like Hushpuppy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout Hushpuppy's vision, we never see Marietta's fa it's always covered, shot from the back, or out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marietta cocks the shotgun with one hand, Terminator 2 st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowers it on the gator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM. Wink sits up in SLOW MOTION- her panties, and her l naked legs are covered with gator blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Wink, her head ABOVE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on her eye. She winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow behind Marietta's supple curves as she walks in the kitchen. Her white slip is almost see through...almos

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Back when Daddy used to talk about Mamma, he'd say she was so pretty she never even had to turn on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her fingers along the counter and the burners IG one by one as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She just walk into a room and water start to boil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water starts to bubbles like a spontaneous volcanic erupt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marietta reaches into the frigidaire, and pulls out two i cold beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice melts down the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens them on the counter, flawlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to Wink. Stands there. A hot mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's voice FADES UP. 33

dialogues.speaker: WINK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your Momma battered that gator up, and set it to fry.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink tips his drink.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Hushpuppy popped into the universe maybe four minutes later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He empties the glass, sufficiently drunk now.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink looks away, lost in his own fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Marietta's shoulder, beads of sweat form along the s of her slip. Good Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink looks, and meets her eyes. The gaze of a proud and smitten man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grits fall through the chimney vent, into the boiling wat Dancing like all the invisible particles of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares hard, her face locked in pride and determination. Filling with all the strength and heroism her long-lost mother. She's ready to snap into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENERGETIC MUSIC drops and we move in a semi-montage throu Hushpuppy's search for survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy rows the Turck through the flooded Bathtub by herself. In the distance she sees a lone horse. It stands on an tiny island of land, the last high ground in an end stretch of water. 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse holds Hushpuppy's gaze. She hears it's strong, resilient HEARTBEAT. They are one and the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy approaches Schoolboat, which has weathered the storm relatively intact.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear RUSTLING and WHISPERING inside school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's three little girls left behind in the storm. JOY STRONG, a tall, wild-haired leader; LIZARD, a tiny thing giant man's tee shirt, and T-LOU, the muscle of this girl gang, looking very meek in her desperate condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are huddled against each other, terrified, hung and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba, shell-shocked but steadfast, steers the b toward the bar, the four girls now safely in her care. Fr the inside we hear CAROUSING, TOASTING, and RAUCOUS CAJUN MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pours a mountain of crab and shrimp at a great commu table, assembled from many different tables.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on lets go! Time to eat! Come on children, feed up time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sends a feast sliding across the floor under the table where Joy, T-Lou, and Lizard dig in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink has decorated the bar with all the waterlogged relic the Bathtub. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a shrine of people's chairs, umbrellas, cloth We're late in the game, and the party has descended into utter debauchery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean raises a glass.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the last of the food!  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the last of the water!  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't drinkin' no water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba pour shots and toasts.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, tastes like more, alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy struggles to peel her shrimps, sitting on top o the table.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For the ones we'd never find, we make a funeral the Bathtub way, with no crying allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunken Wink is giving drunken Walrus a bath as he eats.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the water goes down, I'm gonna French kiss the dirt!  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water's not goin' down man.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, that's my beautiful place under there.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man you know they got plenty of salt coming into that water, everything beautiful is gone. Trees are gonna dies first, then the animals, then the fish.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it under control. 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy picks up a crab. She tries to pound it open, tr yanking on a leg. She can't shell it.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Hushpuppy, come over here lemme show you how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy sits down next to Jean, a good pupil.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN BATTISTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here baby. You hold like this, then you turn it over like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy follows instruction in deep concentration, but bit tentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Wink look away from Walrus and Jo's bawdy humor extravaganza and focus in on Hushpuppy. His disdain is palpable for this froufrou shelling technique.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN BATTISTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be scared of it now. Now, you take this knife, and you pop this off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean holds Hushpuppy's hand and guides a knife to open th belly of the crab.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN BATTISTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Atta girl.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! Hushpuppy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink POUNDS the table. And the party falls suddenly silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pushes the utensil away. He grabs a crab, opens it i three virtuosic hand motions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grease and spice explode everywhere and Wink sucks the fa of the crab clean. It is beautiful to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams a fresh crab in front of Hushpuppy.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beast it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks to Miss Bathsheba for guidance.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard your Daddy. Beast it. 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy pulls on the crab shell with all her might. She doesn't have the power.  EVERYONE (CLAPPING ALONG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids jump out from under the table and chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is turning blue, her eyes bulge with effort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy opens the crab claw and sucks down the meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone goes wild with applause! The kids too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stands up, ascending to the top of the table. S lets loose a WARRIOR CRY and flexes her muscles, deadly triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jo gets so excited she starts dancing on the table She CACKLES and jitterbugs wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walrus gets up to join her. Jean gets up and dances too. All the kids get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink glows with pride. Miss Bathsheba smiles.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea! You see what kinda family we got?! We got feeling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRIVING SCORE kicks in as we MONTAGE through the transformation of the Schoolboat into a ramshackle Ark.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't no time to sit around crying like a bunch of pussies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors whittle sticks into spears, bend metal debr into spikes.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We was gonna build a camp right on top of the Bathtub. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste, cackling wildly, hauls a thrashing goat on floating animal pen. Chicken coops, snake cages, a pig pe are stacking precariously.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got enough animals to eat until the water goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafts are lashed to the sides of the school. Every floati structure left in town is hauled in and added to the Ark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T ties on a floating vegetable garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In WIDE we see what looks like a small village of floatin structures forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bathsheba puts Lizard's head in her lap, Lizard is playing as if she's unconscious after hyperventilating.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teaching a lesson) Come here, like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Hushpuppy's hand and places it on Lizard's ches She moves her hand in a circular motion.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like this. Tee-Lou get some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tee-Lou runs to get a handful of water.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quick little circles. Good for the heart. Joy Strong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy turns her back. Miss Bathsheba shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tee-Lou returns and pours water on Lizard's head, cooling her.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is most important thing I can ever teach y'all. You got to take care of people that's smaller and sweeter than you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy registers this advice, takes it to heart. She r Lizard's chest with delicacy and affection. 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lizard's breathing returns to normal, and she sits up peacefully. Hushpuppy is awestruck. Bathsheba gets to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches Wink sleeping. His breathing has gotten worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tiptoes up with her red basketball jersey and lays it down on Wink, tucking him in just right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISTANT RUMBLING is heard. Cutting off suddenly as we..  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet town, not unlike the Bathtub, but with tangled po lines, electrical towers, and layered hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone flies from behind a house and bounces down the street, denting the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, the peaceful morning transitions into MORE RUMBLI a distant CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the house in the foreground explodes to smithere and the head of an Aurochs drives through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without breaking step, Aurochs maraud the village, trampl it into oblivion. We settle close on an Aurochs eye, emotionless and relentless in its calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink, Hushpuppy, and the Bathtub crew pole the Turck thro a lake blanketed with carcasses, pushing through the dead fish, dead porpoises, dead alligator garfish like they we lily pads. There is no wind, only dense wet heat searing the faces of the characters. The once green foliage has g brown and thirsty. 40

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY V.O.
dialogues.text: Two weeks later, everything started to die.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the water) Come on fishes, where y'at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink empties his net- nothing but a pile of carcasses. He tips it back into the water. Wink pulls himself to the ed and sticks his head under to look for fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks at him with an air of doubt for the first time. Wink looks ridiculous, a dead fish drifts off his head.  HUSHPUPPY (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna leave the Bathtub, Walrus?  WALRUS (WITHOUT THOUGHT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pulls his head back up.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy fidgets guiltily.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's leaving the Bathtub! You don't know nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink lowers his net back in the water.  WINK (CONT'D) (TO WALRUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This water gonna kill us here. We gotta do something `bout this. I ain't starvin' to death while them people go grocery shopping up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids sleep on Miss Bathsheba in a big pile on the flo 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy wakes hearing SHIFTING and a SNAP behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T is uncapping a shotgun shell and pouring black po into a small jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out the window where Jean Battiste is unhooking propane container from Miss Bathsheba's burner. He opens chest freezer and hefts out a 12-foot garfish, dropping t container in the water.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink sneaks up and whispers to Hushpuppy.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, Daddy's gotta take care of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is instantly concerned, she's heard this line before, and it always leads to trouble.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna fix everything back how it was.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything gonna go right back?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, we gonna win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pounds his chest in solidarity. Hushpuppy matches hi pound, but without confidence.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, anything go wrong, Walrus is Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink and Hushpuppy look Walrus-- the face of doddering drunken bewilderment. A goat licks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is not comforted.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be the king of the Bathtub, I promise that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink can see he's getting nowhere. 42   WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit here I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR CLOSING wakes Miss Bathsheba up. She scans the room, noticing the three missing people.  WALRUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an unconvincing lie) I think they be gone. I-I really can't say where.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walrus, don't make me slap your ass! They go to the levee!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walrus is intimidated into silence.

dialogues.speaker: MISS BATHSHEBA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You so much as piss on that wall, you know what them people gonna do? They gonna smoke us out and stick us in a damn shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches Miss Bathsheba go for her boat keys.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daddy says, brave men don't run from their home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy scurries out the side window, escaping outside before Miss Bathsheba sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink, Jean Battiste, and Peter T keep their heads above w as they float under the tarp behind the truck bed. Peter is wearing a life jacket and still has his top hat on.  WINK (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T, don't hold onto me, hold onto the boat. You gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste duct tapes fireworks around the bomb: a pro tank with an igniter made from a battery and a pouch of b powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inserts the bomb into the stomach cavity of a giant garfish carcass. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink shoves two propane tanks inside the belly of the garfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands a rope attached to the igniter to Peter T.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T, you hold the trip-line.  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Soft and sweet) Ok then.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't pull `til I say.  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok then.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it. I have complete faith in you.  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste is hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink gives Jean Battiste a confident nod.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock and load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste carefully unravels the string that leads to fuse. He shoves the igniter down the mouth of the garfish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turck pulls into an enclosed segment of the levee, Wi bobs out from under the Turck and latches a pre-made teth running out of the garfish to a handle on the wall. He bo back under the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy dives under the fishing net on a motor boat jus before Miss Bathsheba charges outside and keys the igniti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy peeks out and the boat roars to life and rips across the water. 44

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The entire universe depends on everything fitting together just right. If you can fix the broken piece, it can all go right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T hand me the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks, Peter T has both hands on the Turck.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter you didn't drop the trip- line?  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter T thinks a moment.

dialogues.speaker: PETER T, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, yes I did.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Peter T.  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink dunks under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink surfaces in front of the igniter rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he grabs the rope, Bathsheba's snake catcher snares hi hand and pulls his arm against the side of her Jon boat.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's how we do with wild animals.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHH! Get off me woman! I'm trying to save the Bathtub

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches the struggle in hiding. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathsheba wrenches the rope out of Wink's hand and chucks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The igniter rope lands in front of Hushpuppy under the ne pile. She grabs it. She reels it in.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the Boat! I'm hauling you're ass back home, little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste swims out of hiding.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink!?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste, get the trip line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Hushpuppy pops out from under the nets, holding rope taught. She stumbles and almost sets if off by accident.  MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy!?  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got it! Pull! Pull!  WINK

dialogues.speaker: NOW BOSS
dialogues.text: MISS BATHSHEBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Hushpuppy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, contemplates in an eerie peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screaming chorus FADES and she is alone in her quiet, eyes darting between Bathsheba and Wink. Courage and certainly clench inside her her. You listen to your Daddy She pulls the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trip-line releases the detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The levee DETONATES. Shattered wood and cement fire towar camera. 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debris propels Hushpuppy backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her quiet resumes as she lands on the deck of the boat in slow motion. She watches in a daze as smoke, water, and flaming dust cycles above her. All the beauty of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water recedes in the Bathtub, revealing the tragic, mud- soaked remnants of their paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy slogs through the muck, each step going two fee down into the stinking filth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew trudges behind her in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blow-up crew crests a hill and sees the remains of th ark sprawled across an open field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's and Hushpuppy's eyes well up as they beholds the s of their island. The water has drained. Everything is dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More striking than the ripped-up houses, the land surroun the island has disappeared. Trees are gone. Shards of mar that had been attached float in the distance. What was a dense, green landscape is barren. The Bathtub is a scorch hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy picks through the rubble of the Shacko in the Backo. She finds their grill, and a window made from a dr door and brings them to Wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shacko has crash landed under the stilts of a house that's been entirely washed away. Wink has done some work reassembling the walls and broken parts into a semi- functional enclosure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy find nails and brings them to Wink, who leans w panels against the stilts from the previous house. 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hammers nails wearily. His strength is sapped. He HACK out bile.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It didn't matter that the water was gone. Sometimes, you can break something so bad, that it can't get put back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy climbs the stairs of the original house to get the top of the Shacko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down through the hole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her POV Wink climbs into bed, he painfully takes his s off. The bruise on his chest has extended all the way acr his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks out on the water for some sign that Marietta's still with her. The light shining on the water off. She sees nothing but dead trees and a defunct oil ri  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma where you at!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in response, we hear a HELICOPTER LOUDSPEAKER.  PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
