dialogues.text: This is a mandatory evacuation area, you can no longer live here. Everyone in this area, has to leave. I repeat....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy wades through the muck in what used to be a lus forest, now reduced to toothpick trees and mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds her storage unit in the tree hollow, and lifts the medicine jar. 48

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When you're small, you gotta fix what you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours the crushed up roots into Wink's mouth, careful to disturb him. Wink dooesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy gently folds in the orange fungus. Quiet, quiet  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink spews up an explosive cloud of medicine.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink grabs her medicine jar and threatens her with it.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smashes it against the wall.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's wrong with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is so upset she doesn't know what to do. She screams in anger.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaaaaaaaaaaaahhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raging, Hushpuppy breaks everything she can get her hands ruining everything Wink's reassembled, tipping shelves, p walls. She grabs a fishing pole and starts bashing Wink's grill over and over.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna throw things? Come on! I can do that too. You want to play that game? Let's throw stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink joins in, breaking stuff too, channeling all his ang into the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink throws himself into the wall. It breaks off and dump series of shelves all over the floor. 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly it's cathartic, they start throwing objects at e other and laughing.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pegs her in the face with a stuffed animal and she grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy throws a pillow!  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy throws a shoe.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy and Wink destroy everything in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something goes off in Wink chest. He grabs his heart and collapses on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy realizes something's not right. She throws a li jacket at her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink continues to force a smile at her. Hushpuppy won't return the smile.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. You think I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's bottom lip starts quivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's smiles disappears.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. No crying. Don't you cry man. Don't you cry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He threatens her with a shoe. Hushpuppy hides behind an overturned chest.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY! Don't cry damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink hangs his head and catches his breath against the wa 50   WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pull himself to his feet and grabs a bottle of moonshi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets up two cups on the table.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pours Hushpuppy a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy sips. Winces. Looks suspiciously at her father. Sips again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink takes one straight from the bottle.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This counts as I'm sorry for a whole buncha things. Lord.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be gone?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No!  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna leave me alone?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't gon' leave nothing.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause if you be gone, I be gone too.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, that is not how it works.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Sometimes in the bed I start shaking and can't stop. I got what you got.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man. That's just a side effect of being a stupid little girl. 51   HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't gonna be dead?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You? No! You gonna live a hundred years more. You know what, show me the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy shoves Wink.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me them guns man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink clears everything off the table with one sweep.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me the guns! Guns! guns! guns! guns! guns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy flexes her biceps. She begins to chant, fierce TRIUMPHANT--  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns! Guns! Guns! Guns!.....  WINK (OVERLAPPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns man, give to me! Guns! Guns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink holds up his hand to arm-wrestle. They SCREAM in tan as Hushpuppy pins him hard.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooo, Hushpuppy you the man. Who the man?  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the man.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the man!?  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the man!  WINK

dialogues.speaker: TELL ME LOUDER WHO THE MAN
dialogues.text: HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm THE MAN!!!!!!! 52   WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink is overcome with love. It's too much for him to bear  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a violent euphoria, Wink grabs the table and hurls it across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This scares Hushpuppy. She stares silently at her wild animal father, longing for something more than rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink takes a step toward like he's going to comfort her, stops, turning back.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta lay down hear? I gotta be strong. Don't be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink lays down in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy doesn't go to bed, she just stands there.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy waits, not backing down.  WINK (CONT'D) (GIVING IN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy goes to Wink.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pats his heart for her to put her head down on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't the one who's sick. 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens to his BIG HUGE HEART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs move into a desolate, barren, wasteland, look exhausted and starved.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Strong animals got no mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold wind blows them backwards. An old Aurochs falls behi the pack. Its legs give out and it lays down. It's not go to make it.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They the type of animals that eats their own Mommas and Daddies.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs cannibalize their fallen comrade, ripping ski and organs in a storm of flesh and gore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CRIES of the screaming mother melt together with anot sound, more MECHANICAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND becomes recognizable as a HELICOPTER PROPELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy opens her eyes, still tucked in Wink's arm. Through the wall she sees FOUR WELL-DRESSED men. They are out of place like aliens exiting their space ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rouses Wink, he hears the FOREIGN SOUNDING VOICES and yanks Hushpuppy up. He instinctively pulls him and Hushpu behind the over-turned table and grabs a broken chair leg defend them with.

dialogues.speaker: EVACUATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (from outside the door) This is a mandatory evacuation area. Everyone in this region has to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink hurls the chair leg at the intruders as they try to enter. 54   WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't going nowhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy grabs a chair leg as well. It's a standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three evacuation workers ram the door of Little Jo's hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jo greets the intruders brandishing a cutting knif and civil war era pistol.  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna have to shoot me cause I'm not going.  EVACUATOR 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am we're not gonna shoot you.  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't never left here and I won't never will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spits. They get closer.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE JO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Son, don't make me cancel your birth certificate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muscle grabs her by the weapons and in the struggle, her to the ground. It's horrible.  EVACUATOR 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, relax ma'am.  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drag Little Jo out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT to Wink and Hushpuppy pinned and being dragged  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off of her! I'm gonna kill you! Let her go! 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH CUT TO an off-white monolithic community center surrounded by a cement parking lot. Stressed, amateur looking doctors from the real world move in and out of th glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift sign reads "Open Arms Processing Center."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the refugee camp is violently, fluorescen lit and painted white in an attempt to maintain a facade sterility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares at the strange and modern ceiling like they've descended from another planet.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It didn't look like a prison, it looked like a fish tank with no water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub residents walk through the gymnasium which ha been converted into a holding tank/hospital for refugees. Student doctors are examining, treating, feeding people. abandoned souls, the sick, and the old are lined up waiti for assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A processed egg patty jiggles weirdly as it hits Hushpupp tray.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MALONEY, a clean-cut, over-extended handsome young do hustles toward the lunch line.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MALONEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Doucet, can I have a word with you, we found something in your test. It's-  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa, not in front of my kid. Stay, Hushpuppy. 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink pulls Maloney out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MALONEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Doucet, there's no easy way to say this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy struggles to hear more, only a couple words com through the din of refugees.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MALONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...require surgery immediately...you need to think about what you want for your daughter...you could die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Hushpuppy's POV: Maloney puts a sympathetic hand on Wi shoulder and Wink pushes it off violently. Maloney puts u his hands in peace and Wink shoves him through one of the curtains and is assaulted by a flood of orderlies.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need nothing from you! You keep your hands off her! I don't need nothing from y'all! Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is snatched as she fights to come to his rescue  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tackle Wink to the ground. He goes limp as he falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK with Wink as he comes to consciousness rolling through the cots. He is sedated and being pushed in a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks through an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Wink's POV- Joy, Tee-Lou, Lizard, and the rest of Bathsheba's original school class play in a room with a BABYSITTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tickles Hushpuppy, who has been given new clothes and looks like a normal little girl for the first time. Her boots and boys underpants have been traded for a delicate blue dress. The image is jarring. 57   BABYSITTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy needs a hug.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your hug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Babysitter squeezes Hushpuppy. Hushpuppy tries to squ away.  BABYSITTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, that's not how nice girls act. Say "I'm sorry ma'am." Hey! Say it. Say it or you're going to corner time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's eyes meet Wink's and she freezes at his horrifying appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink grabs a sofa trying to stop the wheelchair as it rol by. His fingers slips off, too weak to hold on. He tries scream and nothing but a SEDATED MOAN comes out of his mo He tries to pull the tubes out of his arm.  ORDERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently moving Wink's hand AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There there, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares in shock as Wink is wheeled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches in hiding as a hand covered in a rubber glove changes the bandage on a surgical scar; it looks infected and mishandled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same hand puts pills in Wink's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stands over an old man on an artificial respira She's creeps closer, examining him. She puts her head on chest. His heart is beating.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When an animal gets sick here, they plug it into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whispers in his ear. 58   HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She repeats the process with another vegetable.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daddy says, if he ever got so old he couldn't drink beer, or catch catfish, that I had to put him in a boat, and set him on fire, so no one could come plug him into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy peeks through the curtains at another terminal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees two orderlies force pills into Wink's mouth. He' regaining his strength and is able to hold them off momentarily before submitting, and going limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy bolts, unable to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay in the room as the orderlies walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink peeks to make sure they're gone, then spits his pill the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink stares at the ceiling for a long beat. Then, with a burst of energy he grabs his morphine drip and topples himself onto the floor. He pulls his wires out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy lies asleep in a pile with Tee-Lou, Lizard, and Joy. Wink enters and jostles her awake.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss. Let's go.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we goin'? 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink and the girls hustle to the entrance of the Refugee center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walrus comes running down the hall, pushing Peter T on a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink looks bewildered, the rest of the team seems to have their own plan afoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Battiste and Little Jo charge through the cots rilin refugees into revolt as the orderlies chase them trying t maintain decorum.  JEAN BATTISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home! Everybody get up! Don't you want to go home? Lets go! These people don't care about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jo fights off an orderly with a syringe.  LITTLE JO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live in this hell hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink runs the kids toward the bus, they pass two busses labeled for Salt Lake City, Des Moines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink helps Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard get on. Then Hushpupp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Wink's hand slips out of Hushpuppy's. He steps a from the evacuating bus. Hushpuppy turns and the bus door slams between them.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from outside the door) Make sure you put her somewhere good ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink sags. He's giving her away. He turns to leave..  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (banging on the door) NO! I ain't running! No! 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink walks away from the bus, his chest heaving, his face clutched in the horror of what he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the bus pulls forward, then veers violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy charges the driver clawing at her face, punchin and kicking.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver pulls the break and Hushpuppy bangs the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She charges Wink from behind, gives him a diving shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He topples over.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trying to get rid of me! You trying to get rid of me!  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you trying to get rid of me?  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't trying to get rid of you.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You is.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Hushpuppy... I can't take care of you no more.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares him down, accusing.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's dying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's chest heaves up and down.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My blood is eating itself. You know what that means? 61   HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sayin' about dying.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's Daddy dies.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my Daddy.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her defiance is broken and the information starts to sink It hurts Wink as much as it hurts her.  WINK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to watch that, ok? You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink doubles over hacking. He COUGHS horribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks down and sees blood spotting the grass, dripping from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub gangs charges out the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the parking lot they go in a spree of euphoria, co to a halt around Wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy is trying to drag his limp body across the park lot.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jo hold Hushpuppy away from him.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walrus, get me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub crew carries Wink through the entrance to tow His arms slug over Walrus and Jean Battiste, he's barely to help walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sense from the weary faces and silent eyes that it's b a long journey home. 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drag Wink through the Shacko entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone goes in except Hushpuppy who stops outside the d as they lay him down in convulsions. She stays and tries watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink tries to say something to Walrus and can't. Blood bubbles out of his mouth. Wink catches Hushpuppy's eye th looks away as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reeling, but steady, Hushpuppy backs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy walks down the road in an almost eerie state of calm. She takes in the remnants of rusting houses and flipped boats, her lifeless ghost town.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everybody looses the thing that made them, it's even how it's supposed to be in nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now with her three friends, she tip-toes past several humongous footprints up to a gruesome fox carcass. Someth gigantic has ripped open its stomach and gutted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over, unafraid, trying to understand it's meani Flies swarm and nibble, their movement almost elegant. Se in close up, the gory mess has a strange beauty to it.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The brave men stay and watch it happen. They don't run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SONIC BOOM springs her upright, she looks around for th source of the sound. Is it an Aurochs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks towards the muddy bayou. The SONIC BOOM sounds again and the entire body of water quivers with the impac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beacon blinks out on the water. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stares towards it. The children are gathered behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has changed in her eyes. The eerie calm has giv way to a hardened determination. Though unclear to us, he internal path of action is certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath, and lets out a WARRIOR CRY. She runs straight into the water with her girl gang charging behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy, Tee-Lou, Lizard, and Hushpuppy swim through open wat pulling each other forward. They head in the direction of the beacon.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Keep going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to kick toward the light but are getting nowhere the current pulls them backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a BOAT HORN and they look to where an ANCIENT TUG BOAT with a cabin that towers into the sky like a giraffe head, appears through the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls climb aboard, lifting each other onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up to the sound of FOOTSTEPS on the upper deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks up to see SERGEANT MAJOR (60) -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, timeless looking man with a salt and pepper mousta saunters up to the rail. He stares down, examining these runts with an air of suspicion.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going by my Mamma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles broadly, as if this was the secret password. Hi and Hushpuppy stare at each other and immediately there i understanding. Two lost souls in the wilderness.  SERGEANT MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good place to go. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy sits adjacent to the Sergeant in the tug's elev wheelhouse. They are two stories up, and the white walls create a glow that makes us feel like we're almost in ano dimension.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way are we going?  SERGEANT MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter baby, this boat'll take you exactly where you need to be. It's just that type of boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy and Sergeant Major share an ease unlike anyone we've seen Hushpuppy interacted with. The speak like an o teacher with his favorite disciple. They let their silenc last.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MAJOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want a chicken biscuit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy shakes her head `no'.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MAJOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep, far away melancholy settles over him. He munches a chicken biscuit, then tosses the wrapper on the floor. wheelhouse is wall to wall with chicken biscuit wrappers.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT MAJOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I been eating these all my life. I keep the wrappers in the boat, `cause they remind me who I was when I ate each one. The smell make me feel cohesive.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be cohesive.   SERGEANT MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you will be, I got no doubt in my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let this thought settle, then Hushpuppy turns her sw chair back toward the water 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beacon appears through the mist. Hushpuppy's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach, another boat comes into view. A half- sunken barge that looks as though its been rusting in the same position for a century. As we move in we see a lit u sign: "Elysian Fields Floating Catfish Shack GIRLS GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard disembark onto the ba with Sergeant Major following behind. They circle around hatch in the floor with light pulsing out of it. Far-away JAZZ echoes up from the bowels of the ship. They look to each other in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy descends a ladder into a glimmering wonderland. Christmas lights swallow the ceiling, and a light smoke facade encompasses everything. We feel like we're looking a portal into the past, a Belloq-esque turned New Orleans Jazz parlor. The regulars are all oil-workers wooing thei ladies of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a stage with a DJ and two singers, karaokeing al with "Until the Real Thing Comes Along" by Fats Waller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hyperactive MISS FRANKIE, the matriarch of this establishment, comes a'hoppin'.  MISS FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap you have toddlers!  SERGEANT MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Miss Frankie.  MISS FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well butter my butt and call me a biscuit! How you, Sergeant Major? You need some grits?  SERGEANT MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am. 66   MISS FRANKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Sugar, they are so precious! Y'all just as cute as a tub of puppies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women descend on the kids who recoil, not knowing what to with all this affection. Joy Strong puts up her fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy pushes through the crowd nonplussed by the flur of doting ladies. They are not who she is looking for. Th are not who she is looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans pictures of strippers through the ages pasted u all over the ceiling, each of them with a bra hung on it, none of them right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bar patrons nod and tip their glasses to her as she passe ladies smile and return to their drinks, drunk flirtatiou dancers giggle at her, but she remains unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches two swinging doors that lead to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stops. Sniffs. Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: in Hushpuppy's POV, smoke curls through the swinging doors, the light illuminating the dust particles It's a magic kitchen. Her POV tilts down to the floor whe a pair of well-pedicured feet in flip-flops walks towards swinging doors. They open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy holds her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous COOK (35) wearing a baseball cap and an apron comes out the double doors. She wipes some sweat off her brow. She watches the band and kills a bottle of ice-cold beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook looks down. Sees Hushpuppy.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need something baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy nods, holding her breath. She still can't speak  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well whatchu want? You alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too stunned, too shy to speak. 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook takes stock of the helpless creature in front of her. Like a butcher shop owner with a pesky hungry puppy, she submits to Hushpuppy's longing gaze.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in here, I'm'll show you a magic trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy follows her into the magic kitchen, knocking he head against the swinging doors on her way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the smooth fanfare of a circus performer, The Cook l an egg, opens a beer bottle with her teeth, SPITS the cap the egg and it cracks over the grits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's face is joy beyond all measure. She watches t Cook's flying hands, she prepares everything in a single motion, it's like a dance. She slaps a fresh alligator ta on the table and begins sawing through the scales.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you somethin', when you're a child people tell you that everything's gonna be all hunky- dory and all that bullshit, but I'm here to tell you that it's not. So get that out your head right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes the knife from the gator and aims it at Hushp like its a pointer.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's some big old feast, yeah, but you? You ain't nothin' but a stupid little waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scales a gator, strips the bones, dredges, fries.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you got on your platter gonna fall on the floor and ain't nobody gonna be there to pick it up for you. Someday it's all gonna be on you. 68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stirs the grits. Grits on plate. Gator on plate. Plat in front of Hushpuppy. Lemon is squeezed all over everything.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So smile, girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy tries to crack a grin. She barely remembers how smile and it comes out all wrong. The Cook shakes her hea opens another beer on her teeth, and heads for the pantry  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody likes a pity-party-having- ass-woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stays behind staring into the floating particle dust in the incandescent light-- stars of the universe. T golden bubbling fry pot-- lava of the molten core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four perfect gator nuggets are placed next to a sumptuous dollop of grits.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gator's magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy looks up from her food-hypnosis.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (encouraging a smile) Awwwwwwwww.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real smile emerges across Hushpuppy's face.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic soars as the couples rock back and forth on the dan floor. Strippers cradle their dates. It's all very sweet and tender. This seems to be the M.O of this strip club, slow-dance not pole-dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are each dancing with a stripper, glowing with l They are orphans in a heaven of mothers. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We float back to Hushpuppy, the camera dances with her an the Cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook squeezes Hushpuppy and spins her. Each time we catch their face their eyes are wetter and wetter.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take care of me. Me and Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook shakes her head `no.'  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know nothing bout your Daddy, I can't take care of nobody but myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sinks into Hushpuppy.  COOK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stay if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy considers this for a moment, squeezes the Cook.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my favorite thing.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A far-away look has come over her. Her mind is somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I can count all the time I've been lifted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look up at a face that's slowly coming into focus- it' Wink, younger and healthier.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I can count all the times I've been lifted on two fingers. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is the first sight of the slimy newborn baby girl tuck in his arm. Baby Hushpuppy stares up at him as he carries her.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Wink! Bring my baby here! They need to wash her off.  WINK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, that waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Hushpuppy's huge-eyed, warped facial expression ogle Wink. She coos.  WINK (CONT'D) (TO HUSHPUPPY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright fatso, breathe some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through a doorway and sun washes over Baby Hushpuppy. She smiles and smiles at the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in reality Hushpuppy gathers herself. She's suddenly not hugging back, just being held.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go home.  COOK (WHISPERED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy cups her hand to the Cook's ear and whispers something inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook squeezes her tight, seeming on the verge of adop her. But she can't. She spins Hushpuppy around and around then puts her down withouth meeting her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches her disappear into the crowd of swaying couples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All goes quiet, and we sit behind Hushpuppy's head, a sea light like a crown around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC SWELLS. Decisively, with the force of a charging general, Hushpuppy turns and runs toward camera. 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT to Hushpuppy leading Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard across a ridge dotted with Dead Oak trees, she's come bac the Bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves over the water, past the dead oaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We turn the corner past a stretch of marsh, and come upon Aurochs, four of them, now suddenly and viscerally in the landscape of the Bathtub, swimming steadily toward solid land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub crew sits by Wink's bed. His eyes are open, b everyone is silently waiting for the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children crest the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLE of Aurochs hoofs is suddenly and violently audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy turns. She catches a glimpses of something mass moving behind the distant oaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids turn and hustle down the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy, Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard hustle down hill with increased urgency. The DISTANT TRAMPLING is growing loude

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Hushpuppy the dark shapes of the Aurochs crest the ridge in a deafening STAMPEDE. Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard scream and sprint out in front of Hushpuppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy walks steadily forward, refusing to run. Her fa locked with determination, she is unafraid. Her eyes shoo toward the shacko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink, with all his strength looks toward Hushpuppy, their eyes meet. 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Wink's POV, Hushpuppy stops dead on the bridge, waitin for her fate, staring toward her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs bear down on Hushpuppy from behind, their footsteps rattling the frame. They grow inconceivably lar the camera has to tilt to hold the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy balls her fists and stands her ground. Suddenly she turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs ROARS. Then, inches away from Hushpuppy, she stops. She SNORTS, blowing Hushpuppy's hair back. Hushpup doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs stares face to face with Hushpuppy. Sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink is frozen in wonder, unable to believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy raises her chin in confident defiance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in full profile, we see the Aurochs towering 15-feet tall, she takes a step forwards, sniffs again. A low SNOR or is it a purr?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs lowers her head with respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes well with emotion, recognizing one of her own. A ferocious warrior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aurochs steps back, takes a knee, and with a BELLY FL that rattles the very earth, she lays down. Her three companions follow suit, their fat tummies settling into a almost joyful, lazy, repass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange calm has settled over Hushpuppy. Almost a smile but more of a peace and an affection for her equal. They' both children in their way.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my friend, kind of. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Aurochs grunts, a sentence only Hushpuppy can understand.  HUSHPUPPY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take care of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With weary and clumsy steps, the Aurochs stand and retrea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy approaches the shacko. It's like walking the plank, but she's unafraid, at one with her destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub crew look on her in awe. They part ways to le her pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the door, steeling her reserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink is curled up on Hushpuppy's bed-- very, very thin. H eyes are closed. His chest heaves up and down in short violent breaths. Hushpuppy stands and stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink looks at Hushpuppy in reverence. He knows it's the l time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink motions for her to come closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy inches toward him. It takes all of her might. S sits on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy takes her to-go container from Elysian Fields o of a paper bag and pops it. She unwraps a gator nugget, d it in hot sauce, and holds it out for Wink to take a bite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy watches as Wink chews weakly. She eats one herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink and Hushpuppy draw it out. They don't want it to end It takes a full minute for him to swallow the first bite, she paces herself to finish when he does.  WINK (BARELY AUDIBLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's chest heaves up and down, harder and harder. A tea rolls down his face.  WINK (CONT'D) (CHOKING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No crying, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds them back, being tough for her Daddy.  HUSHPUPPY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy's face hardens, and even as the tears fall, we a strength and composure that only Wink could have put th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls into his arms and he embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy squeezes Wink. She does not let go. She stays strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wink's hand trembles on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds him as his deep, warm, heartbeat slows, slows, stops. His weight slumps over her. She keeps on holding him, but she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadfast, Hushpuppy holds a torch on the edge of the Bathtub. The Turck, piled with branches, floats in front her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lowers the flame and lights a cloth covering Wink's b aflame. She pushes the funeral pyre out into the current. We watch the boat flames drift into the foreground, cover Hushpuppy face with flames. She looks into them in all he grief and wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group begins a funeral prayer, playing quiet in the background as Hushpuppy contemplates the pyre.  PETER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I stand by the bayou,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else joins him.  EVERYONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship at my side starts her motors and sails for the gulf. I watch her until she disappears. "There! (MORE) 75  EVERYONE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone!" Gone where? Gone from my eyes, that's all. She's just as big as when she left me. And somewhere else, other voices are calling out, "Here she comes!" And that is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise their drinks to the sky and shout in unison.  EVERYONE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy gazes into the sparks leaping off the top of th fire are foregrounded in front of Hushpuppy, particles of Wink jumping into the sky. HORNS ENTER, droning low, and building into an funeral dirge.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When I relax behind my eyes I see everything that made me flying around in invisible pieces. When I look too hard it goes away, but when it all goes quiet, I see they are right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turck almost disappears over the horizon. The HORNS t a hopeful turn, the melancholy of the dirge mixing with t anthem of the Bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I see that I'm a little piece of a big, big universe, and that makes things right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy stands tiny on the ledge of the Earth, framed i front of an expanse of endless water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathtub gang marches across the marsh road. Hands tou the town sign, saying goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: HUSHPUPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When I die, the scientists of the future, they gonna find it all. They gonna know, once there was a Hushpuppy, and she lived with her Daddy in the Bathtub. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT WIDE to reveal that the water is rising and washin over the road. Our heroes are marching on the final slive of land. The camera flies backwards, and our view of the road disappears into mist and churning waves. They appear be walking on water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hushpuppy leads them forward, into the future.
